comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Could be Edward Holton James, editor of The Liberator, and nephew of Henry James, the novelist. See NYT of January 13, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=990DEFDA163FE633A... "E.H. JAMES ARRIVES TO CHAMPION MYLIUS; Novelist's Nephew Wrote Article About King George for Which Man Held Here Went to Prison." The NYT article has a physical description that is consistent with the picture. The article referred to in the headline, in the Liberator (a magazine with the agenda of getting monarchies to become republics) alleged that King George V had been secretly married when Prince of Wales and had fathered two children. A colleague involved in the publication of the article had served a prison term in the UK for libel and was now being held at Ellis Island.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9905E0DF1439E333A... is a piece about the libel case from the February 5, 1911 NYT.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Photo from Corbis looks like the same guy some years later, in 1927. He clearly kept up his provocative behavior. See www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,730942,00.html?...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Holton_James

comment.author: 34876228@N04
comment._content: Yes, thanks for research. It does appear to be the same fellow. We'll make the correction.
